ProgramElementMissionDescription.val: Marine Helicopter Squadron One (HMX-1) is required to provide safe and timely transportation for the President and Vice President of the United States, heads of state and others as directed by the White House Military Office. Currently two Type, Model, Series aircraft are used by HMX-1 for the Presidential support mission - the VH-3D and the VH-60N. The VXX program is the replacement helicopter for the VH-3D and VH-60N. An Acquisition Strategy is being established. Funding includes pre-Milestone (MS) B risk reduction activities, capability based assessments, Concept of Operations development, specification development, system concept development, threat analysis, will cost/should cost strategies, establishing affordability targets, and recommended cost control measures. Following a successful MS B decision and entrance into the Engineering and Manufacturing Development Phase, activities will focus on the integration of systems, production and qualification of test articles, demonstration of system integration, interoperability, safety and utility.

SummaryExplanation.val:
Technical: Not applicable.

Schedule:  The VXX acquisition strategy and timelines has resulted in MS B moving to Q2 FY14 and this is reflected in the new exhibit.

ProjectMissionDescription.val: Marine Helicopter Squadron One (HMX-1) is required to provide safe and timely transportation for the President and Vice President of the United States, heads of state and others as directed by the White House Military Office. Currently two Type, Model, Series aircraft are used by HMX-1 for the Presidential support mission - the VH-3D and the VH-60N. The VXX will replace the VH-3D and VH-60N. The VXX Acquisition Strategy includes pre-Milestone (MS) B risk reduction activities, capability based assessments, Concept of Operations development, specification development, system concept development, threat analysis, will cost/should cost strategies, establishing affordability targets, and recommended cost control measures. Following a successful MS B decision and entrance into the Engineering and Manufacturing Development Phase, activities will focus on the integration of systems, production and qualification of test articles, demonstration of system integration, interoperability, safety and utility.

Text.val: Continue the funded activities of the proposed material solutions, including: reducing technology risk, determining and maturing the appropriate set of technologies, and to demonstrate technology on prototypes.

Prepare for the Engineering and Manufacturing Development Phase funded activities of the proposed material solutions, including: reducing technology risk, determining and maturing the appropriate set of technologies, and to demonstrate technology on prototypes.

Continue preparations for the Engineering and Manufacturing Development (EMD) Phase including reducing technology risk, prototyping, and activities in support of MS B, EMD contract award and EMD contract execution.
Support VXX test and evaluation planning and documentation.

Provides Government VXX systems engineering support to accomplish technical activities to include trade studies and risk reduction efforts.
Provides Government VXX systems engineering support to accomplish technical activities to include trade studies and risk reduction efforts.

Provides funding to accomplish technical activities to include trade studies and risk reduction efforts.  Following a successful MS B decision, entrance into the Engineering and Manufacturing Development (EMD) Phase, and EMD contract award, funding will support EMD contract execution.

AcquisitionStrategy.val: The Acquisition Strategy will be provided and approved in support of the pre-Engineering and Manufacturing Development (pre-EMD) Review. An estimated date for MS B is second quarter FY 2014. The VXX program continues to pursue risk reduction activities, capability based assessments, Concept of Operations development, trade study analysis, specification development, system concept development, threat analysis, will cost/should cost strategies, establishing affordability targets, and recommended cost control measures.

PerformanceMetrics.val: Major Defense Acquisition Program performance metrics will be provided upon program Acquisition Category designation.
